teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Trolltur
teams.loan_because: Everybody deserves the opportunity to follow their dreams.
teams.description: The love of trekking and the wonderful experience of wild life in the norwegian mountains and forests is the greatest way to spend time and philosophize of life`s true meaning.

teams.name: Team Japan
teams.loan_because: we feel that we can help the world, one person at a time.
teams.description:
There are many Kiva lenders who live in Japan, and we hope to be able to make a difference, not only as individuals, but now as a team. Please feel free to join us....not only from anywhere in Japan, but anywhere in the world. All you need is an interest in Japan. 

一緒に貧困をなくしましょう．．．お待ちしています！

(Picture: Mt. Fuji and the full moon at sunrise New Year's Day 2010 写真：朝日の富士山と満月２０１０年元日）

teams.name: Seafood Asia
teams.loan_because:
1 - Families need food and jobs
2 - A fish farmer is never hungry but always busy
3 - We want to help fishers who can't find fish anymore
4 - We want to let fish stocks recover 
5 - We love eating seafood so we must farm fish
6 - We believe aquaculture is the future of seafood supply
7 - We loan because we can make a big difference
teams.description:
NEW !

This is a new group aimed primarily at fish farmers and fishermen and fisherwoman who want to swap from fishing to farming.

We will also loan to others in the aquaculture value chain, i.e. equipment or feed suppliers, hatcheries, fish merchants, fish markets, fish processors, value add business etc


Please read - "Green Economy Report" by United Nations
Note especially Fisheries and Water sections.

teams.description: We are Buddhists of all variety, but focus here is on the way of the Boddhisatva.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:

http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising

teams.name: The Emboatening Crew
teams.loan_because: We have a religious obligation to care for the needy, including providing boats to the boatless.  (Emboatening, embovining, emgoatening, em-oatening, emroofening....)
teams.description: Originally a Kemetic pagan group organised for Opet, we are an association of pagans of all flavors and our friends, many of whom hang out at eCauldron.com.

teams.name: LARPers, Freeformers & Friends
teams.loan_because: we can imagine being in the shoes of others.
teams.description: We share interests, hobbies, and a desire to improve the lives of people around the world.

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: Cheeseheads For Change
teams.loan_because: If you give a man a fish, you feed him for a day.  Now in the modern world, you can give that same man a loan to buy a fishing pole, he catches fish with his new pole to feed his family, his community improves because of his financial success, he pays the loan back, and  you can re-loan that money again to help someone else buy a fishing pole . . . wait, that sounds like a conspiracy by the Rapala Corporation to sell more fishing equipment, what are we supporting here ;-)
teams.description: Our Kiva lending team is a non-political group consisting of Green Bay Packers fans lovingly known as Cheeseheads, and anyone who lives in or has ties to the great state of Wisconsin and is interested in making the world a better place.

teams.name: Loyola Microfinance Cooperative
teams.loan_because:
The Loyola University Maryland: Microfinance Club hopes to promote and engage in direct investment in entrepreneurs and businesses in need of crucial loans to better their own lives. Our object is to be productive member of a movement to fashion a world in which as many materially poor and near-poor households as possible have permanent access to an appropriate range of high quality financial services, including not just credit, but also savings, insurance, and fund transfers.

We also seek to create an environment of cooperation on campus in which students, faculty and staff become more educated on issues affecting marginalized people around our world as part of the Jesuit mission of being women and men for and with others.
teams.description: We are a group of college students interested in sharing our resources for the good of people around the world.

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: Triangle Freethought Society
teams.loan_because: We care!
teams.description:
Our main purpose is to stand up for the separation of church and state as guaranteed by the First Amendment to the Constitution of the United States. Additionally, we work to:

Ensure that non-religious people enjoy the same rights as religious citizens
Raise awareness and educate the general population about the concerns and issues facing the nontheist community
Protect reason-based and scientific education within our school systems
Engage in organized charitable and community improvement projects
Create a sense of community for the nontheist population in our geographical area and beyond
TFS is also an affiliate organization of the American Humanist Association (AHA).

teams.name: Friends of Turning International (Catherine Transler)
teams.loan_because: We have been priviledged to grow in a society where we learned to read during our childhood. As adults, we were privileged to travel and discover new cultures. We have seen that many others do not have this chance. By lending a few dollars, we can help some people realize their dreams and help their communities to get better health and eduction. Little step by little step, all together, we can make the world a better place to live in.
teams.description: I have made this group to lend half of the benefits of my book "Turning International" to Kiva. If people enjoyed the book and want to join my efforts, they can join this team.

teams.name: Worldette
teams.loan_because: We love to travel and improve our own lives but we care enough to help other women and men around the world experience freedom and prosperity too.

teams.name: Lend for Layton
teams.loan_because: Love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we’ll change the world.
teams.description: In memory of Jack Layton (1950-2011)

teams.name: Team Toronto
teams.loan_because: The people who are lucky enough to live in Toronto care about creating a self sustaining legacy in all parts of civilization, and wish that economic conditions in more of the world could be like they are here.
teams.description: This team began with one person, but soon gained strength and momentum through the generosity of the people of Toronto, Canada and their friends. Now this team has over 300 members, has loaned hundreds of thousands of dollars over the past six years and is helping people all over the world. Join us today!!

teams.name: Portugal
teams.loan_because:
Honramos o legado deixado pelos nossos antepassados que espalharam cultura, conhecimento e valores por todo o mundo. Onde há um português, há um amigo pronto a ajudar e dar esperança aos que mais precisam. Isto é Portugal.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
We honor the legacy of our ancestors who spread our culture, knowledge and values around the world. Wherever there is a Portuguese, there is a friend willing to help and give hope to those in need. This is Portugal.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142

teams.name: ehMac
teams.loan_because: We share a common interest in caring Canadians using our Macs and our resources to lend a hand to our fellow humans.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Java users around the world
teams.loan_because:
We strongly belive in that even small things could change the world.
"Be the change you want to see in the world!"  - Gandhi
teams.description: We share a common interest Java and surrounding  technology's. Regardless of your knowledge of Java your welcome to join this lending team.

teams.name: Cissell Family & Friends
teams.loan_because: We can.

teams.name: Meeting Point
teams.loan_because:
[PT] Acreditamos que os nossos pequenos investimentos causam um grande impacto na vida das pessoas e na vida das suas famílias.
[EN] We believe our small investments make a big impact in peoples lives and the lives of their families.
teams.description:
[PT] Somos membros de uma comunidade que acredita que Jesus nos deu uma nova vida: uma em que temos a oportunidade de amar Deus e amar pessoas.
[EN] We are members of a community that believes Jesus gave us a new life: one where we get to love God and love people.

teams.name: Away Inward Foundation
teams.loan_because: We want to share the awareness of abundance. When we raise the spirits of one, we raise the spirits of all.
teams.description: A grassroots growing community of caring individuals doing our part to make the world a more loving place. Change begins with each of us.

teams.name: Tuffy Finance
teams.loan_because: because we are a global community based in Oakland.  We can enjoy Microfinance because it helps us understand the world economy on a local sale, and because we can work collaboratively to raise money for places where one day we may find ourselves.
teams.description: A group of dedicated high-school and middle school students from Oakland, CA interested in the world and making a difference.

teams.name: 37 people
teams.loan_because: 37 people can't be wrong...
teams.description:
"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world.  Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has."

 - Margaret Mead

teams.name: Brigham Young University BYU
teams.loan_because: We support the growth of people, communities, and business across the globe.
teams.description: We are made up of BYU students, alumni, and friends.  We understand that everyone, whether a student or a doctor, can lend to make a difference to someone on the other side of the planet.

teams.name: Team Virginia
teams.loan_because: We give new meaning to the phrase "Commonwealth of Virginia."  We Virginians are thrilled to pool our common resources to help entrepreneurs all over the world as they improve their lives and their communities.
teams.description:
From the Appalachian Mountains to Virginia Beach (and equally welcoming of members outside the state), we are enthusiastic Kiva lenders privileged to have ties to the great state of Virginia. 
( Photo Copyright 2007 D L Ennis all rights reserved http://dlennis.wordpress.com )

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.
